TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ItemAutomationPeer extends System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer implements class System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider
Public MustInherit Class ItemAutomationPeer Inherits AutomationPeer Implements IVirtualizedItemProvider
type ItemAutomationPeer = class inherit AutomationPeer interface IVirtualizedItemProvider

Docs.summary: Exposes a data item in an collection to UI Automation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Data items that are not also <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> types do not have children; however, they can have a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree and a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree.
For example, a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ListBox> can have a collection of strings that contain data items. When those items are processed by an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl> for visualization, a <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree is created for them. This tree can have a corresponding [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree. After the tree is created, [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] merges the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree into a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] tree. <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> works with its <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> counterpart, if it exists, to obtain more information about the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> tree.
Only visible data items, or more precisely, the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have this dualism. Non-visible data items, which have no corresponding <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> trees, have only one <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>.

Docs.summary: Gets the string that uniquely identifies the that corresponds to the data item in the collection that is associated with this .
Docs.returns: A string that contains the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_uiautomation](~/includes/tla2sharptla-uiautomation-md.md)] identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property. If the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property is not set, the value is the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance string GetNameCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function GetNameCore () As String

Docs.summary: Gets the text label of the that corresponds to the data item in the collection that is associated with this .
Docs.returns: The text label.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can think of the name property as if it were a string of text that users use to explain which control they are referring to. Make certain that you have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object GetPattern(valuetype System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface patternInterface) cil managed

Docs.param: An enumeration value that specifies the control pattern.
Docs.summary: Returns the object that supports the specified control pattern of the element that is associated with this automation peer.
Docs.returns: An object that supports the control pattern if is a supported value; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks If `patternInterface` is <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface.VirtualizedItem?displayProperty=nameWithType> and the item is not in the visual tree, this method returns a `this` pointer. If `patternInterface` equals <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.PatternInterface.SynchronizedInput?displayProperty=nameWithType>, this method returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.ISynchronizedInputProvider> interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection. The user might understand the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)]. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement%2A>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool IsOffscreenCore() cil managed
Protected Overrides Function IsOffscreenCore () As Boolean

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the specified is off the screen.
Docs.returns: if the specified is not on the screen; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.UIElement> corresponds to the data item in the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ItemsControl.Items%2A> collection that is associated with this <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer>. This method is called by <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen%2A>.
This method does not indicate whether the element is visible. In some circumstances, an element is on the screen but is still not visible. For example, if the element is obscured by other elements, it might not be visible. In this case, the method returns `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider.Realize() cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Makes the virtual item fully accessible as a UI Automation element.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ItemAutomationPeer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Provider.IVirtualizedItemProvider> interface.
